instructions: Image titled Skype Step 7 1 Review your Skype contacts. Click the "Contacts" icon, which resembles a silhouette of a person in the upper-left corner of the Skype window, to do so. You'll see a list of contacts associated with your Microsoft account and/or phone number. Image titled Skype Step 8 2 Select a contact. Click a contact to open a chat with them. If you don't have any contacts associated with your Microsoft email address or phone number, type a person's name into the "Search Skype" text field, then select your preferred contact. Image titled Skype Step 9 3 Click the message field. It's the "Type a message" text box at the bottom of the Skype window. Image titled Skype Step 10 4 Enter a message. Type in a message that you want to send to your contact. Image titled Skype Step 11 5 Press . Doing so will send a message to the person, thus beginning a new conversation. You should see the conversation appear in the left-hand window of Skype, allowing you to revisit the conversation at any time by clicking it. Advertisement

Image titled Skype Step 16 1 Select a chat. Click the conversation with the contact whom you want to call, or start a new conversation . Image titled Skype Step 17 2 Click the "Call" button. This is a phone receiver-shaped icon in the upper-right side of the window. Doing so will initiate a video call to the person or group of people. If you want to make a video call, click the video camera icon here instead. Image titled Skype Step 18 3 Switch to video. Click the video camera icon with a slash through it to turn on your camera. This will allow your contact(s) to see whatever your camera is facing. You can also turn back off video by clicking the video camera icon here. Image titled Skype Step 19 4 End the call. Click the red "End call" button at the bottom of the Skype page to do so. Advertisement

Image titled Skype Step 20 1 Know that you can use Skype to make calls from your computer to a phone. Although Skype offers free calls over the internet, you can add credit to your account if you want to use Skype to call a telephone number. Save for in Australia, the UK, Denmark, and Finland, Skype cannot be used to call emergency services . [1] Image titled Skype Step 21 2 Open the dial pad. Click the grid of dots in the top-left side of the Skype window. You should see a number pad open. Image titled Skype Step 22 3 Click . This link is at the bottom of the dial pad. Doing so will open the Skype Credit page in your browser. Image titled Skype Step 23 4 Select an amount of credit to add. Click the box to the left of either the "$10.00" heading or the "$25.00" heading. If you want to have the credit refill automatically once it's depleted, check the "Enable Auto-recharge" box as well. Image titled Skype Step 24 5 Click . It's a blue button near the bottom of the page. Image titled Skype Step 25 6 Select a payment method. Click one of the cards (or payment methods) listed on the left side of the page. If you don't have a card on file with Microsoft, you'll need to enter card details (e.g., your card name, number, expiration date, and security code) before proceeding. Image titled Skype Step 26 7 Click . It's a blue button near the bottom of the page. This will purchase your selected amount of call credit, allowing you to make calls to normal phones via the dial pad in Skype. Advertisement
